image.altText: A girl doing homework on a laptop

props.synopsis: Child health and wellbeing researchers have welcomed an independent review criticising the COVID-19 pandemic response in relation to young people.

title.children: Researchers welcome review finding pandemic response had 'significant and negative' impacts on children

image.altText: A man and woman put their arms around each other.

props.synopsis: A community hub is being established in Melbourne's east, as tributes continue to flow for 11-year-old Jack Davey, who was killed after a car drove into a primary school fence on Tuesday.

title.children: Support hub to be established as community grieves 11yo student killed in Melbourne school crash

image.altText: the front door to a cellar door at Buller Wines in Rutherglen

props.synopsis: A magistrate has told victims of an explosion at a gin distillery that no sentence imposed on the business can undo the personal toll on them.

title.children: 'Horrific' ethanol explosion lands Rutherglen winery a $50,000 fine

image.altText: A black sign with green letters reading "For Lease, Apartment 1".

props.synopsis: "No fault" evictions will be banned, application fees scrapped and the cost of breaking a lease capped to four weeks' rent under new reforms proposed by the Victorian government.

title.children: Renters' rights in the spotlight as Victorian government announces six new reforms

image.altText: Death cap mushrooms.

props.synopsis: An elderly woman died in Melbourne's east after consuming a meal that contained poisonous mushrooms foraged from her own garden. Coronial findings into her death were released on Wednesday.

title.children: Coroner issues warning after elderly Victorian woman dies from eating wild mushrooms

image.altText: An old photo of Keith Hyman held by Gary Lasky.

props.synopsis: The family of a man killed "execution-style" nearly 50 years ago at a jeweller's office in Melbourne's CBD has made a fresh appeal for information about his murder.

title.children: Fifty years after the 'execution-style' killing of three men in a jewellery robbery, a Melbourne family wants answers

image.altText: Two photos of Keith on the table

props.synopsis: The family of a man killed in a jewellery heist nearly 50 years ago has described the devastating impact of the murder.

title.children: Listen ðŸ“» | Devastated family of man killed in unsolved murder appeal for information

image.altText: Two power transmission towers in the middle of an open field with a sunrise in the background.

props.synopsis: Farmers along the proposed route of a major overhead transmission line in Western Victoria vow to protest against the project and prevent access to their land.

title.children: Victorian farmers seething at final route of renewable energy transmission line

image.altText: Donald Trump, dressed in a suit and red tie, leans into a microphone looking out a crowd.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is under fire over comments a comedian made about Puerto Rico at a New York rally. But so far he has not acknowledged the anger and hurt that members of the community feel despite courting their votes in a must-win state.

title.children: It's a common adage that America has made its mind up on Trump. But has his campaign finally gone too far?

image.altText: Youth detained inside Darwin's Don Dale Juvenile Prison.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are searching for two teenagers who escaped from Alice Springs Youth Detention Centre, ahead of planned transfers to Darwin.

title.children: Alice Springs youth detainees escape ahead of planned prisoner transfers to Darwin

image.altText: A woman in a white coveralls stands next two two people on the footpath near an area cordoned off by crime scene tape

props.synopsis: South Australian police are investigating whether the death of a 26-year-old woman with "significant physical and intellectual disabilities" was the result of criminal neglect.

title.children: Death of 26yo woman who lived with 'significant' disabilities in 'squalid' conditions declared a major crime

image.altText: An illustration shows one woman with her hand to her forehead, on the phone, and another with her head in her hands

props.synopsis: Decriminalisation was meant to give women access to safe, affordable abortions as a form of health care. Five years on, the ABC can reveal glaring examples of the system failing people in rural and regional areas at almost every step.Â

title.children: Abortion is legal in Australia, but these women are being refused treatment. Doctors fear it's an 'unspoken ban'

image.altText: A person shopping at Australian grocery store, with a basket full of sparkling water, fruits and vegetables.

props.synopsis: Prices rose by 0.2 per cent in the September quarter, according to the ABS, compared to the 1 per cent rise in the three months through June. Underlying inflation remains above the Reserve Bank's target.

title.children: Price pressures ease with inflation at 3.5-year low but rate cuts expected to be further away

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a suit, stands in front of a Qantas plane, with the logo visible.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has rejected claims he called former Qantas boss Alan Joyce to request flight upgrades, but independent senator David Pocock says there is a bigger problem.

title.children: 'Were there text messages?' Pocock says Albanese's Qantas controversy is part of a bigger problem

image.altText: An Ikea sign in front of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: IKEA has promised to pay $9.9 million to political prisoners of the East German dictatorship who were forced to make its products in the late 1970s and early 1980s.

title.children: IKEA pledges to pay millions to East German prisoners for forced labour

image.altText: Kim Jong Un and Vladimir Putin shaking hands in front of two flags.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon statement marks the first US confirmation that North Korean troops have been deployed in the region.

title.children: 'Small number' of North Korean troops already deployed in Kursk, Pentagon says

image.altText: A man in a blue suit is surrounded by men in military camouflage

props.synopsis: The former Malaysian leader faces 20 years in prison and a fine five times the amount allegedly involved in the offences linked to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad fund if found guilty.

title.children: Ex-Malaysian PM Najib Razak facing 25 new charges over multi-billion-dollar corruption scandal

image.altText: Former president of the Philippines Rodrigo Duterte is led to a senate hearing. He is surrounded by a number of people

props.synopsis: He says the squad was run by "gangsters" of hit men to crack down on drug-related crime and kill those involved.

title.children: Rodrigo Duterte's 'death squad' claims to be investigated by Philippine police

image.altText: upright rat

props.synopsis: Scientists say their research shows the rats have a similar sense of smell to dogs, but they're able to fit in tighter spaces.

title.children: Meet Kirsty, Betty and Desmond â€” the giant rats fighting the illegal animal trade

image.altText: Portrait photo of David DePape. He has shoulder length hair, stubble, and brown eyes.

props.synopsis: Paul Pelosi was severely injured when he was attacked with a hammer in his San Francisco home in 2022. David DePape was sentenced to life in prison on state charges after also being sentenced to 30 years in a federal court.Â

title.children: Man who attacked Nancy Pelosi's husband gets life term

image.altText: Grace Nweke of New Zealand and Courtney Bruce of Australia compete for the ball above their head

props.synopsis: A relentless defensive performance by Courtney Bruce and Sunday Aryang has been the foundation for the Diamonds' pride-restoring 13-goal victory over New Zealand.

title.children: Relentless defence inspires Diamonds to commanding win over Silver Ferns

image.altText: Several men in military fatigues ride on the back of a vehicle with the number plate 'Indonesia'

props.synopsis: China has historically been seen as the greatest threat to national security by Indonesia's military, including new President Prabowo Subianto. That is changing.

title.children: Make EVs not war: Why Indonesia driving off Chinese vessels in the South China Sea is unlikely to escalate

image.altText: four people stand holding a paper which says annual report

props.synopsis: The Vatican's child protection commission's first annual report found the church must do a better job of handling compensation for the victims of clergy sexual abuse. The commission said compensation went beyond money and included "a much broader spectrum of actions."Â

title.children: Vatican commission says Catholic Church must do better job on compensating abuse victims

image.altText: A picture of two jack o lantern pumpkins on a porch

props.synopsis: More than one in five Australians are set to celebrate Halloween this year. Here's why its popularity has exploded.Â

title.children: Why Australians are celebrating Halloween more than ever

image.altText: A man's torso can be seen with a white top on and a watch on his wrist. He's holding a pen in his write hand preparing to write.

props.synopsis: While serving time, these prisoners are helping authorities rewrite the way Victoria does criminal justice. Experts say it's best practice, but it's hard to get a clear answer from prison authorities.

title.children: Prisoners told the ABC they fought for wireless phones in their cells, now Corrections doesn't want to talk about it

image.altText: Mark Butler

props.synopsis: Mark Butler says the leaders who oversaw Australia's COVID-19 pandemic response don't need to say sorry to rebuild public trust.

title.children: Health minister says leaders don't need to say sorry for COVID response

image.altText: Billy Bob Thornton played Santa in the movie "Bad Santa".

props.synopsis: Playing bad Santa this Christmas may not please your friends and family, but it could just save them some money if they have a mortgage.Â

title.children: Why Christmas cheer threatens to further delay interest rate relief

image.altText: A man with a half smile and wire-free rimmed glasses poses for a photo.

props.synopsis: Zhang Yiming, 41, topped the Hurun China Rich List with a personal wealth of around $75 billion, but China has lost a third of its billionaires since its peak in 2021.

title.children: China's new richest man is wealthier than 90 countries

image.altText: Woman with bandage on wound where she lost arm

props.synopsis: A North Queensland woman whose own dog bit off her forearm is devastated that police had to shoot her pet dead.Â

title.children: Woman whose dog bit off her forearm says she wishes she'd been able to save her pet

image.altText: A photo of Todd Mengaldo in a hoodie kneeling down.

props.synopsis: Police have charged Todd Menegaldo with manslaughter after the death of Seddon man Andrew Truman.

title.children: Police charge man with manslaughter in connection to deadly Melbourne CBD assault

image.altText: Children playing at a childcare centre

props.synopsis: About 12,000 early childhood educators are set to lock in a 10 per cent pay rise before Christmas.

title.children: Pay rises secured for 12,000 childcare workers in 'game changer' deal

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair next to a woman standing outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Rob Pyne says he is facing the possibility of having to resign as a Cairns councillor after being ordered to pay damages for defaming a local government executive whom he likened to a Star Wars villain.

title.children: Former Queensland MP and former activist ordered to pay six-figure sums for defamation

image.altText: The silhouette of two young people looking out onto a beach at sunset

props.synopsis: More than one in four young people are experiencing serious threats of violence by a sibling, according to new research obtained by triple j hack.

title.children: Sibling-to-sibling violence is thought to be very common. Why don't we know more about it?
